review.reviewBody: I bought at end of season & have not had a real chance to wear it skiing.  I like the style, fit, color & lots of pockets.
review.name: Pockets & style

review.reviewBody: The jacket is very warm and has lots of good features. The only short coming is the external chest pocket is Very shallow and everytime I open it on the lift stuff falls out. Would be perfect if it were deeper and had a second zippered pocket inside of it. Part of the issue is that the Internal and external pockets are back to back which limits space.
review.name: Great jacket!

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this jacket! I ordered the Iced Matcha and it the most lovely color, a light springy green. This jacket fits great. The jacket fits well with enough room underneath to add a layer or two. I love the phone pocket on the chest that is extra insulated. The arms are long, but it’s actually a nice feature as I can reach my hands over my head and not expose any wrist. The jacket is surprisingly warm and the hood that fit over your helmet and face guard is good for keeping the wind out. Quality is great!
review.name: Perfect Ski Jacket

review.reviewBody: This jacket comes HUGE! I usually wear a size S/M. I ordered small and it is HUGE! Order size down. I also ordered HH pants and they were also HUGE. Apparently HH does their sizing differently than other companies. The armpit area is also very tight while the arms are ridiculously long. I really wanted to love this jacket, but couldn't. Otherwise, quality seems very good and as advertised. I also love the purple/orange color.
review.name: Order size down!!!

review.reviewBody: I have found this jacket to be a great investment in my skiing endeavors. Yes, the arms are long, but I like that the sleeves will cover half of my mittens, providing more insulation, no matter what position my arms are. There is internal hand fabric to put your thumb and four fingers through. There is no dearth of pockets, either! HH thought of everything, pockets for my gloves, goggles, cell phone, and even a special pouch for my ski pass. I am 5’6”, 130 pounds, and the relaxed fit size S was perfect. It is roomy enough for me to not feel constricted in any way. It keeps me warm. I like that the hood can go over my helmet for windy days, and the fun color with black and neon orange accents look cool. I love it so much.
review.name: Great Ski Jacket

review.reviewBody: Loved everything about this jacket on paper: great colors, quality brand, plenty of pockets, longer design. However was a bit disappointed when trying it on with my ski gear. The sleeves are way too long and very awkward to use with velcro and any gloves someone might definitely want to wear. In addition, I did not enjoy the design of the collar that must be zipped up all the way over a helmet and can't really be worn any different way if you dont want your neck to freeze. There are plenty of times that I want to not wear a hood over my helmet and want to cool down a bit, but hate having to feel a drastic change in temperature on my exposed neck. The only way to avoid this is to keep the front part zipped up, covering half of your face, just very awkward design. The jacket also runs narrow around the hips area and gets tight while wearing bulky ski pants. I would order a size up in this case but given the already long sleeves, would not want even longer sleeves to deal with.
review.name: very awkward design

review.reviewBody: I bought this in size small. I liked the jacket itself - seemed to have all the things I wanted in a ski jacket, plenty of good pockets, insulated, nice color (purple), wrist gaiters. I debated what size to get and using the size chart and Helly Hansen's website's size estimator, which suggests S or M. I'm 5'2" and about 130 lbs, small bust ~32. I prefer to buy outerwear slightly large, especially for skiing, because may need to put several layers underneath. The body itself was large and generous, which I didn't mind since I'd rather have space to layer if needed. The real problem was the sleeves. They were extremely long, like an entire hand's length too long. Even with tightening up the cuffs of the sleeves, it was still fitting very oddly and bunched up throughout the arm to the shoulder area. I would like to try this in a smaller size, but paying for return shipping twice gets expensive, so I'm returning it instead. Probably worth trying if you have longer arms. Disappointed as I really wanted this to work.
review.name: Sleeves too long

name: Powderqueen 3.0 Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Great fitting, cozy down jacket that keeps me warm in the moderate to cold Calgary winter. I really like the fit, I’m 5’9” and typically can’t use thumb holes because they cut in at my webbing from the arms being too short, the arms of this jacket are long enough that the thumb loops are comfortable! I never use the drawstring waist but its a nice feature to have.
review.name: Good fit, warm

review.reviewBody: Really pleased with the warmth without the weight. Soft and quiet with movement, covers longer in back and hips. The only wish is that it have a double zip so you could zip up from bottom, but other than that it's a great jacket.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: Love this coat overall CONS I have noticed cold drafts in the shoulders and underside of arms and the zipper part that zips into the pull part looks worn or something but I think it's just cut that way . I just hope it lasts the test of time . ADVANTAGES Otherwise I love this jacket . I had a more expensive very popular down hoodie from the "P" brand that wasn't nearly as warm and made me look frumpy . This jacket looks great and falls evenly over my 5'5 185lb frame.I am normally XL but I ordered size large because everyone says this runs large and they were right it fits me perfect as a standalone layer. The torso of this jacket is 100% superbly warm and I LOVE how high the collar comes up around my neck and keeps me toasty warm. The jacket is light and it really does look good on a fuller frame .  I think outdoor research nailed this one and if you're considering other brands just get this one. I own lots of high end lightweight down jackets and this one beats out all of them for style , comfort and warmth
review.name: Just go for it

review.reviewBody: The biggest, warmest puffy I own.  I sized up from my usual size (I got a large, instead of a medium), and it is perfect. I can wear other layers underneath, and it almost covers my butt.  It is great for NW MT winters. I live in this all winter long.
review.name: Excellent warm & big puffy

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love and keep this item. Unfortunately, the size was way too big. I am 5'3" and 145 lbs. I am usually a M/L to a L, so I assumed based on all of the reviews, that a M would be the right fit. The M fits like a L or even XL. I was swimming in it.  I would still live to exchange for a smaller size, however the sale is over, so I would be paying double.
review.name: Way too big!

review.reviewBody: I love this coat but I try not to wear it in dirty places since the color shows stains easily
review.name: Super warm and nice fit

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my mother who is always cold. Very warm, this beats out other puffy jackets we tried without being the size of a parka. Word of warning, they do run slightly large in size so take into account when purchasing.
review.name: Very warm

review.reviewBody: After quite a bit of research, I chose this jacket to replace my MEC down jacket. Although some reviews feel this jacket fits too large, I appreciate the room for layering and that it can accommodate my broader shoulders.
review.name: So Cozy & Fits Great

review.reviewBody: Just came back from Iceland. I’m so glad I got this jacket. Love it
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: I feel like MH can be hit or miss in some quality and for the price of this jacket, I expect the best. I believe it’s a well made jacket and fits me perfect with a light or heavy sweater on. Perfect wind breaker as well. Loved the blue color. I bought this hoping it’s way more watereproof than my last brand jacket. I got caught in heavy rain and was wet almost immediately and it made me hunt for what I hope will be better experience next time around with this jacket. Haven’t had a chance to find out yet.
review.name: Fits great, not so tight or too baggy.

review.reviewBody: I have been in several downpours, one was for 3 hours. All dry. I was rowing my drift boat, could breath a little better. There is always a compromise.
review.name: Dry in heavy rain

review.reviewBody: The design of this jacket is very well thought out. The size and cut is awesome, just the right length. The oversized hood shrinks down and fits snug on your head with a nice brim. The pit vents are perfectly placed which is awesome with the large front pocket/vents. It’s very lightweight and storable which is a bonus. It looks good, and if you read up on the tech in this jacket on the pertex website, it’s pretty cool
review.name: Awesome shell!

review.reviewBody:
This is my dream alpine climbing jacket. The cut and fit is superb with excellent underarm lift and pockets that I can access with a harness on. 
The hood fits well over a helmet and the elastic trim allows the hood to move side to side with my head.
review.name: The ultimate super light alpine jacket

description: Buy the Gregory Alpaca Gear Pod 10L online or shop all Overlanding from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Alpaca Gear Pod 10L
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Alpaca Gear Pod 10L online or shop all Overlanding from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Love this Packing Cube.  We use it in a travel van and it makes organizing our clothes so simple.  This cube has foam in the sides so it has some rigidity but is not hard.  Very good design
review.name: Great Packing Cube!

review.reviewBody: so helpful for organizing my stuff. The mesh is a little stretchy so you can slightly overstuff and you can see into the mash so you know what’s in your organizer
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: We ordered a combination or two Pod 10 and four Pod 5 to fit in one of the gear boxes. They have a solid structure and all fit nicely to help organize of camping gear. The sturdy mesh lets you see inside, but doesn’t collapse when stacked on top of each other. The top handles lets you grab the pod that’s needed. There is a loop at the top so you can hang it from a carabiner. Much better quality than I was expecting.
review.name: Sturdy, Roomy, Outstanding Quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I KNOW this is meant for camping, but I’m definitely using it for travel. Since it isn’t floppy, the structured sides make packing a breeze. So glad I selected this.
review.name: Structured Packing Cube

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this pod/packing cube type thing. This is very heavy duty and durable compared to any I've seen on the market. The first thing I noticed was the handle placement on top followed by the mesh. I believe this would be great for taking to the gym or on a hike your damp/sweaty items would be able to breath in this container. Another great use for long hikes is to use it to keep bugs away from your food while you prepare other parts of your meal (maybe not hot items). You can keep all your essentials in one place. It fits quite a bit. It has a heavy duty looking dual zipper, the kind that doesn't come off it's tracks, a sturdy base, mesh top and padded sides. I see myself getting a lot of use out of this item.
review.name: This is super high quality!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is so cute and perfect for so many different uses - I love the fact that it has a mesh top so depending what I’m using it for the contents can breathe but will still keep pesky gnats and bugs at bay. It’s got a great little handle so it’s easy to carry around and the dual zipper is perfect too. I’m so glad I have this. It’s going to be coming with us on all our family trips.
review.name: Definitely a Versatile Essential -

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My husband used this to go to a training for work. It held a lot and was very sturdy. He really enjoyed using this. We will definitely be buying more.
review.name: Sturdy
comment: Thank you for taking the time to leave your review. We are happy to hear you liked the product! The low star rating does not match the information given, so we will connect with you in case there's anything else we should know about your experience.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely love the Alpaca brand for their sturdy, quality-made organizational products! This 10 liter gear pod is collapsible to store when not in use but then has the most sturdy walls and padded bottom for when your needing to pack items for a hike, traveling, or anything else you may need to tote items for. The dual-zippered top and thick, quality-made handle makes this pod look and feel like it will last a lifetime, hence their lifetime guarantee on their products!! The mesh top makes your items/gear easily visible and it holds so much! I will always stand behind this brand!
review.name: Sturdy, Quality Made Oranization!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Received this as a sample from Influenster for my honest review. I was very surprised with the quality of the material. The bag was made with long lasting durability in mind. The mesh top of the bag is great for keeping things in the bag that needs breathing room. I like the top also for being able to see in the bag. I would highly recommend this product and myself will be ordering another bag.
review.name: Great durable material

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really like this pod, it’s 10L so it can hold quite a bit, I like that it has a mesh top so you can see what’s inside. I ended up using this as a organizer for my cars trunk
review.name: I love it

name: Alpaca Gear Pod 10L

review.name: Ankle deck boots, poor quality

review.reviewBody: I bought my boots almost a yr. ago to date. both have cracks in the rubber where the toes bend. XTRA tuffs are not what they used to be. I really liked them till they started failing. I replaced a pair of the old original tuffs I bought 15+ yrs ago which were still useable when I replaced them.
review.name: Not what they used to be!

review.reviewBody: Overrated Have had 2 pairs both cracked leak less than a year old, third pair pull tab broke less than month in. All 3 same size and they all fit different Rocky boot brands has really fallen off
review.name: Don’t waste your money
comment:
Hello,
Sorry to hear about the issues you are having with your boots.  We are here to help and want to be sure you are 100% satisfied with your purchase. Please reach out to our team at xtratufcustomersupport@rockybrands.com.  You can also contact us via chat on our website during business hours.  We look forward to assisting you.

review.reviewBody: My boyfriend absolutely loves these boots!! He loves to wear them even when he’s not going fishing. He says they are very comfortable and fit him very well, even with his feet usually not fitting comfortably into most shoes.
review.name: Great Gift For The Men In Your Life!

review.reviewBody: Very slippery on wooden docks or the aluminum government docks at most landings or wet concrete or asphalt.  Treacherous on wet grass. These are just OK on fiberglass boat floors, but you will not like these anywhere else. Wish I could get a refund.
review.name: Slippery
comment:
Hello,
We are sorry to hear that your boots are slippery.  This is not what we would expect to be the case with these boots. Please reach out to our customer care team so we can make sure you are satisfied with your purchase. We appreciate your support. xtratufcustomersupport@rockybrands.com

review.reviewBody: I barely used them. The rubber is cracking. This is poor quality material, unbefitting of the price tag.
review.name: Bad quality rubber.
comment:
Hello Bob,
This is not what we would expect to happen with your new boots! Please reach out to our support team so we can get this issue taken care of right away! We want you to be 100% satisfied with your purchase.  xtratufcustomersupport@rockybrands.com

review.name: One of the best ever

review.reviewBody: My favorite pair of shoes for everything, so good i need a third pair

comment:
Hi,

Thank you for your feedback! We are sorry to hear your Stow bottle is leaking and not working as intended. Please let us make this right by filing a warranty claim using the link below so we can send you a replacement Stow bottle.

review.reviewBody: Easy to fill, stow, and care for after the hike.  I followed a commentors advise and froze one full and one half full then topped it with water at the start of the hike.  Had cold water throughout the day.
review.name: Works well!

review.reviewBody: It's a nice bottle but I purchased it for backpacking and for some reason, the Sawyer coupler is really challenging to screw on to it even though it should be compatible.

comment:
Hi,

Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to  hear you are enjoying your Stow bottle. Our Stow bottles fit most 28mm threads, unfortunately not all of them. If you are looking for a filter kit, we recommend using our HydraPak 28mm Filter Kit that pairs perfectly with our Stow collection.

Thank you again!

review.reviewBody: Great water container - love the supple feel and its capacity to fit in a variety of places in my pack, car, travel bag. It's spill-proof, easy to clean, and the loop means I can attach it to my harness or outside of my pack with a carabiner. Perfect purchase!
review.name: Best water container for outdoor adventures

review.reviewBody: My coworker had this Pak (likely from a previous year), and the cap had coverage so it was spill proof. My flip cap is fully open without the little soft plastic cover and I wish they still made it spill proof…
review.name: no longer spill proof
comment:
Thank you for the feedback, we appreciate it! We can gladly replace your Stow cap under our warranty program, since it is not functioning as intended. Please file a claim here:
https://support.hydrapak.com/hc/en-us

After you have filed a claim, we will respond to your ticket very quickly, usually within 1-2 days.

Thank you!

review.reviewBody: I lost my 1st hydropac at an airport. Sooo happy to have a replacement!
review.name: Best water bottle for travel!!

review.reviewBody: It's a nice size if you think you'll just need one or two water stops pn uour walk or ride. But, the water tastes foul.
review.name: Water tastes foul
comment:
Hi ,

We are sorry you are experiencing a bad taste with your product. As a leading provider of performance hydration, any issue with our product is taken seriously. Our products are made from a food-grade Thermoplastic Polyurethane (TPU) material. We have used this material since 2001 and it is used by many of our competitors. It is the industry standard because of its food-safe properties and its durability.

TPU is safe, reliable and non toxic. It’s 100% BPA and PVC free: every one of our products meets or exceeds the most rigorous national food safety standards in the world. Unfortunately, a small percentage of flask and reservoir users can experience an unpleasant taste, which varies from person to person. Please try to following to reduce the taste issue:

1) Fill the container up with water and add a few drops of lemon juice (about 1 teaspoon). Then place into your freezer and let it freeze overnight. Take the frozen container out of the freezer and let it thaw completely. Dump out lemon juice water and then rinse. The taste should be diminished.

2 ) Alternatively, you can fill the container up with milk (powdered milk works for this as well) and place it into the refrigerator for 24 hours. Then completely clean and dry the container. 

3) You can also use a Bottle Bright tablet and soak it with warm water for 30+ minutes. Then empty and rinse the reservoir or container, scrubbing it with a bristle brush. Rinse once more, completely and let dry fully prior to using.

4) For those that are extra sensitive to taste, we recommend using a Nuun tablet or a drop or two of lemon juice in their reservoir or container during activity. 

If these solutions do not work for you, please let us know

review.reviewBody: I work in a rail yard and a full bottle fell out of my pocket.  I wasn't sure where it fell out so was unable to find it.  This happened in November.  I was working last night (middle of february) and I found the bottle with water still in it.  The only thing wrong was a busted cap cover.  Through all the freeze and thaw of the winter and all the garbage that gets tossed around the rail yard, it still functions as it should.  Very impressed.
review.name: Tougher than expected

name: Stow 1L Water Bottle

Keeps you warm when needed but and you can layer it well with other items such as t-shirts or track jackets.

description: Buy the MSR Alpine 2 Stainless Steel Pot Set online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Alpine 2 Stainless Steel Pot Set
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Alpine 2 Stainless Steel Pot Set online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have used these for a few decades, and i still find them to be the lightest, most versatile pots for backpacking. I usually take one pot, the lid, and the handle on each trip. The lid works as a frypan.
review.name: Useful and efficient

review.reviewBody: The best most durable lifetime cook pots. Everything just right, nothing wrong x 25 years.
review.name: The Best

review.reviewBody: I’ve had this set for over 30 years and it’s still going strong. It’s not the lightest but when cooking for a group it just can’t be beat.
review.name: Will last forever

review.reviewBody: I've been using this cookset for over 20 years. We added a couple of plates and bowls, but the design is perfect. Using the lid as both a lid and a frying pan, we have never been unable to cook a perfect meal in field. It cleans up easily, and being stainless steel, if we burn in the pans, it is easily cleaned up.
review.name: Excellent cookware and longevity

review.reviewBody: Classic & simple pot set perfect for car camping. I’ve had a set of these pots for close to 20 years and recently just purchased a second set for my new camper. They tuck perfectly into my camp kitchen box & can handle cooking almost everything. The lid doubles as a fry pan, though it’s better for things like a quick sauté with lots of oil rather than pancakes (it’s hard to flip & easy to accidentally burn the cakes). These pots clean up easily inside & out, in case you cook over a fire with them. The pot grip is reliable and sturdy, which is great when draining a full pot of pasta’
review.name: Excellent and reliable forever pot set

review.reviewBody:
One of the first things that I bought when I got into backpacking in the 1990s was an Alpine cookset. That pot set has travelled all over the country with me from backcounty canoeing in the Boundary Waters to sea kayaking in the Aleutian Islands. I lost my XPD heat exchanger in the Bering Sea, scorched and warped the pot lid using it as a heat diffuser, and otherwise dented blackened and abused this cookset for nearly thirty years before losing it to theft. I'm back for another. 

I do use lighter Titan pots for backpacking these days, but if you're looking for a cookset that will never wear out and you don't mind a touch more weight, the Alpine is the way to go. It's perfect for car camping, canoe camping, sea kayaking and any other outdoor activity where you're not looking to shave weight down to the last gram.
review.name: Lifetime Durability

review.reviewBody: I have been using this pot set for eight years! I got it as a wedding gift and absolutely love it. I boil water in it mostly and it is very fast on a whisperlite. Cleanup is easy when making Mac n cheese for my toddler too!
review.name: 8 years, still going strong

review.reviewBody: This is a good, durable set of pans for those times when shaving ounces is not the highest priority.
review.name: This is a good, durable

review.reviewBody: Nice kit, I was happy with its performance on a 2 night backpacking trip. The stainless steel feels very durable. I’m expecting I will use this set for many years to come.
review.name: Nice sturdy cook set

review.reviewBody: Love this set! Great quality/durability at a relatively low weight. I love the size of the set: perfect for my stove and fuel canister all packed nicely into the included carrying case. Would highly recommend!
review.name: Great Pot Set

name: Alpine 2 Stainless Steel Pot Set

review.reviewBody: I was looking to replace an old mammut personal anchor system and this was the closest I could find. Works great
review.name: Simple and works

review.reviewBody: This PAS does exactly what you hope it would-keeps you feeling safe as you dangle hundreds of feet off the deck.
review.name: Great PAS

review.reviewBody: This is a good compromise PAS with respect to strength x weight. There are lighter and heavier alternatives from other brands, depending on the intended use this one hits a sweet spot.
review.name: Strong PAS

review.reviewBody: I used to use a 24 inch sling for a personal anchor but found that it was to long or too short far too often. Love the simplicity of this and it works perfectly without the added cost or complications of a connect adjust
review.name: Love the adjustment

review.reviewBody: Use this PAS for lead climbing and indoor route setting. Easy, dependable, and simple. Solid product, that's reasonably priced.
review.name: Great, dependable PAS

review.reviewBody: Love the white/color on this product, works like a charm
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: Works great for what it does. Probably will not replace when this has run out of useful life. A double-length sling is more versatile and with the correct knot can be set to whatever length you desire.
Easy to use, feels nicer than other competitors anchor systems. Solids piece of pro that belongs on everyone’s gear rack
review.name: Solid piece of pro

review.reviewBody: Awesome for use as a personal anchor system. Love the ability to easily choose different lengths without having to adjust like some other anchor systems.
Only complaint is how fixed the lengths are once you've chosen which loop to lock into.
review.name: Great PAS

description: Buy the Patagonia Tech Web Belt - Men's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Tech Web Belt - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Patagonia Tech Web Belt - Men's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Tech Web Belt - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Patagonia Tech Web Belt - Men's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I like this belt because it stays tight.  I had to cut around 4 inches off.
review.name: Patagonia Belt

review.reviewBody:
okay belt.  very sturdy.
Maybe a bit too sturdy.  It has very thick webbing and a largish buckle.
The webbing end is flat and thick.  Most belts cut a bevel in the end so it can be threaded into the buckle more easily. Surprised Patagonia didn't do this.
review.name: not well thought out

review.reviewBody: I purchased one of these belts last year on a chance as I have found other similar style belts generally slip. Since I purchased the belt I have bought two others. These belts are great. The buckle mechanism which is a single cast piece of metal with cast in place teeth and no moving parts. The teeth lock firmly on the quality nylon belt webbing giving you a snug and firm fit. The only issue I have with the belt - which is to be expected with a one-size-fits-all - is that it is a little long for me. My waist size is 33'.  I easily shortened the belt with a tool called a hot knife which is used for cutting synthetic fabrics, dock lines, etc.  The hot knife fuses the belt end to match the factory cut and prevents the webbing from fraying. All in very happy with this belt.
review.name: Won't Be Disappointed

review.reviewBody: The belt would not hold for me. It kept slipping which negated my purpose of keeping my pants up.
review.name: Slips

review.reviewBody: Still wearing the one i bought in 2009.
review.name: Worth it

name: Tech Web Belt - Men's

description: Buy the Mountain House Veggie Chorizo Breakfast Scramble online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Veggie Chorizo Breakfast Scramble
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain House Veggie Chorizo Breakfast Scramble online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought a pouch with my last order, ate it this morning, very tasty.  I like it better than the breakfast skillet pouch.
review.name: Yummy

review.reviewBody: Mountain House is the best tasting shelf life food.I tried quite a few different brands. Mountains house is far the best.
review.name: Tastey

review.reviewBody:
I bought one of everything... And so far everything is good 
.
review.name: Did not try yet. But have Never been disappointed

review.reviewBody: I have not tried this particulal meal, but over the years in my survival, camping, and hiking efforts around the US, I have never been disapointed with any of the Mountian House products.
review.name: Great Product

review.reviewBody: The veggie chorizo in this smelled AMAZING!  I was so excited to try it and have another breakfast option… but it hardly tasted like anything.  It was honestly like having a flavored seltzer - the smell almost makes you think you taste something, but not really.  One of the very few Mountain House meals we haven’t liked.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: I travel to the U.S. annually from the UK and spend time in the wilderness enjoying Mountain House meals. They are the best trail freeze dried meals I have ever purchased - every packet is tasty and infinitely better than anything I can buy in the UK.
review.name: Superb as always.

review.reviewBody: It had great flavor and will be a nice addition to mix up morning breakfast. It reminds me of the Breakfast Skillet meal, but with even more flavor from the chorizo. I really enjoyed this meal at home, so I know I will love it on the trail.
review.name: Great flavor

review.reviewBody: I bought this as an alternative to regular breakfast meat for my husband. It was good for me but he did not care for the veggie chorizo. He would prefer just eggs and veggies with no alternative meat option.
review.name: Easy and interesting  but 2 different results

review.reviewBody: This was my first time trying this meal.  I tried it at home on a rainy day.  It was surprisingly good!  Very tasty.  A tad bit spicy for ME.  I added a bit of Velveeta squeeze cheese from a packet and it was VERY GOOD.  I'm not vegetarian..but try different things now n then.   My favorite is still BEEF STEW...I would eat it daily if I could afford it.  Lol.  Have not had the chance to have the others yet...saving them as emergency ration..fla. hurricanes.  But have had them before and really enjoy them.  I usually buy 1 or 2 at the store on grocery day.  I like to eat them at home when I don't want to cook...I'm 70..I get lazy.  I like I can have them from a camp stove..camp fire..anywhere anytime..NO muss no fuss a HOT hearty meal...on the road on the shore at the horse show or in my yard.  Thank you!!!   Just wish they were a bit less expensive..I'd buy more but social security only let's me buy a few at a time.
review.name: Veggie chorizo

review.reviewBody: My husband and I have been car camping for years. We love to ski, hike, camp and don't like to spend a lot of time cooking.  We've tried countless freeze dried meals. Our favorite is the Veggie Chorizo Breakfast Scramble. I'm a vegetarian my husband is not.
review.name: Favorite Breakfast

name: Veggie Chorizo Breakfast Scramble

review.itemreviewed: Escape Snow 59 Posigrip + Prolink Auto Binding - 2025
review.reviewBody: Title says it all. The prolink auto is easy to use, particularly if you're a cyclist and are used to clipless. The skis themselves are great and love the low maintenance of the fish scales, as I only need to use one type of wax and not have to worry about grip wax or skin protection. Overall, these have been great on groomed trails and when you need to make your own.
review.name: Great set for beginners

review.itemreviewed: Escape Snow 59 Posigrip + Prolink Auto Binding - 2025
review.reviewBody: I wanted a low end fish scale classic ski that still provided good kick and glide. I love the graduated and shorter scale pattern. Performed better than other brands I tried.
review.name: Simply perfect for frogging around

name: Escape Snow 59 Posigrip + Prolink Auto Binding - 2025

Buy the Simms Riverkit Wader Tote online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Riverkit Wader Tote
hasVariant.description: Buy the Simms Riverkit Wader Tote online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is a great way to keep your muddy/wet waders abd boots together until they can be cleaned up and dried. It is also a good place to store them. We also carry a piece of artificial grass to stand on while putting the waders on. This is a good product.
review.name: Good idea for waders

review.reviewBody: My new Riverkit Wader Tote bag is perfect for my waders and boots. It has a nice section that unfolds so you can step on without ruining your stocking foot boots on any rough sharp surfaces on the ground. The bag was well thought out.
review.name: Riverkit Wader Tote

review.reviewBody: Great bag, but the long flap (for standing on while putting waders on) is not necessary.  Kind of gets in the way.
More storage spots than the taco, and a little thicker fabric, but you pay for it, excellent option though.
review.name: Great wader bag

review.reviewBody: Haven’t used it on the river yet, but I’m excited to! It will easily fit my boots, waders, jacket, and gloves (5’6” female, size US 8 shoe). It will be nice to have a place to stand and not be balancing on one foot any longer getting dressed. I’m going to add a way to add a shoulder strap or backpack strap for walking through tight/wooded/steep areas when you need both hands for poles/stability.
review.name: Just needs a hands-free strap.

review.reviewBody: Great size for my waders, boots and a couple extras.
review.name: Camo wader sack

review.reviewBody: The perfect bag to put on, take off and carry my waders to the river. The bag has plenty of room for my waders, sz 13 boots and even my chest pack. The way the bag lays out so I don’t have to stand on the ground when putting my waders on or taking them off is a nice addition, I can get rid of my old carpet now. The bag allows the boots and wader to drain on the ride home, I usually take them out of the bag overnight to make sure they are completely dry and put them back in and they are ready to go.
review.name: Percfect Bag

review.reviewBody: A great way to keep your waders and boots all in one place, quality construction.
review.name: Good buy

review.reviewBody:
Great bag just as described. I like the fold out pad, outside pocket and the wader style tie downs that keep it nice and neat and compact. I fish at least 100 days a years and this bag looks tough enough to last for quite a few seasons. The shape is also, for me, much better than the taco style bag
Thanks Patrick
Love this wader bag! Packs great with lots of room and protective mat keeps your waders from contact with sharp objects and dirt.

name: Riverkit Wader Tote

review.itemreviewed: Fuego Down Vest - Plus Size - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love this vest so much! It’s so well made, so comfy, and I love their colors! It fits amazing and looks great!
review.name: Love this vest!

review.itemreviewed: Fuego Down Vest - Plus Size - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the well thought out zippered pockets on the outside along with the zippered pocket inside & larger pocket that you can also pack the vest into. It's not too bulky but is plenty warm especially when zipped up. Going to get a lot of uses this winter!
review.name: Practical & stylish

review.itemreviewed: Fuego Down Vest - Plus Size - Women's
review.reviewBody: This vest has great vibrant colors and has just the right amount of loft. I can wear it on hikes as well as out to dinner. There is a definite youthful look to this jacket. Thanks Cotopaxi.
review.name: Awesome vest!

review.itemreviewed: Fuego Down Vest - Plus Size - Women's
review.reviewBody: I own several Cotopaxi items and love them all and this down vest doesn’t disappoint. I love how warm it keeps you and it’s easy to layer and extremely packable. It has already become my favorite.
review.name: Love this vest!

review.itemreviewed: Fuego Down Vest - Plus Size - Women's
review.reviewBody: I absolutely love my vest, it is the perfect weight to layer over a sweater or sweatshirt and be comfortable in our Colorado temperatures. It is so comfy and soft! I love it!!!!
review.name: My go to vest!!

review.itemreviewed: Fuego Down Vest - Plus Size - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great fit and light weight. I liked it so much I purchased a second one in a different color.
review.name: Fuego Vest

review.itemreviewed: Fuego Down Vest - Plus Size - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very stylish, warm, and lightweight! I got my husband a men’s one and he never takes it off.
review.name: Fuego Down Vest Women

review.itemreviewed: Fuego Down Vest - Plus Size - Women's
review.reviewBody: Go to choice. . I own 6 in several colors plus have given them as gifts.
review.name: Fuego Vest

review.itemreviewed: Fuego Down Vest - Plus Size - Women's
review.reviewBody: Got this as a gift for my daughter! It is warm and wear it over hoodies. Nice vest!
review.name: Nice Down Vest

review.itemreviewed: Fuego Down Vest - Plus Size - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love the vest, I wear it all the time. Warm, good fit and get lots of compliments on it.
review.name: Great purchase!

description: Buy the Lezyne Flow Water Bottle Cage online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Flow Water Bottle Cage
hasVariant.description: Buy the Lezyne Flow Water Bottle Cage online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Solid bottle cage.  Put it on my gravel bike and it holds full bottles well over rough terrain.  Liked it enough that I bought a second one for my commuter bike.  I would not recommend for a road bike, because the fit is quite snug and requires more effort than is desirable to pull the bottle on a road bike ride.
review.name: Lezyne bottle cage

review.reviewBody: I mounted these bottle cages to my gravel bike. This was a mathch made in heaven. Bottles have a positive "snap" into position so I know when they are not going to get launched out onto the trail/road. I've got a riding friend that's going to buy a set after having one of his bottles go on roll about. It was a tough cattle crossing that tested his cages. I am using a 1 liter smart water bottle too. Mine didn't budge on that metal beast of a cattle gaurd.
review.name: I've been using these for three months.

name: Flow Water Bottle Cage

description: Buy the Black Diamond Stopper Set #4-13 online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Stopper Set #4-13
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Stopper Set #4-13 online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Simple design. Easy to use. Can’t beat a good solid nut placement. Great for building anchors or backing something up. Inexpensive protection every trad climber should have in their bag.
review.name: Stoppers work!

review.reviewBody: Great variety of sizes for the common climber. You’ll have no problem finding a stopper for a finger/ish sized constriction. Comes with a wire gate carabiner to attach to your harness or sling. Don’t forget to buy the nut removal tool too!
review.name: Nuts about these stoppers!

review.reviewBody: The slight concave side helps with maximizing contact on placements
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: Exactly what I needed. Work well for climbing on granite!
review.name: Great set of nuts

review.reviewBody: A lot of people act like cams are always better because they actively engaged the rock. But there's been so many times where a BD stopped is definitively the better fit. Gotta have them.
review.name: Classic and Reliable

review.reviewBody: Fair price for the quality of protection you get from these!
review.name: Honest review

review.reviewBody: this range or stoppers made the most sense for me as a beginner tradder, though I've recently found a use case for a #2
review.name: works as expected

review.reviewBody: Kind of regretting not getting the larger set with the #1-3
review.name: Awesome set

review.reviewBody: I struggle to remove them done times but I think that's kind of the point. They feel sturdy and are easy to trust.
review.name: Work great

review.reviewBody: BD Stopper set have been excellent. I started out just placing gear while learning to lead on a top rope with a tail at Devils Lake and Petenwell Rock in Wisconsin. I’ve put a high value on stopper placement on trad because of there utility and flexibility once you have the placement down. I highly recommend this product to anyone starting out in trad climbing!
review.name: Rock’n Nutz!!

name: Stopper Set #4-13

review.itemreviewed: Fractal Midweight High Roller Top - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I have a few different baselayers from Le Bent. While all are comfy and soft, I especially like the versatility of this style. The fabric appears luxe but it's not so thick that it bunches up and gets weird underneath your ski jacket. It's a GREAT layer for skiing and work. I like how it's a little dressier than your average baselayer. I'll get away with layering this under a tunic or sweater, which I can then ditch for a few laps out on the hill - then back to work. 

Highly recommend, it's my fav baselayer in my closet (and I have many).
review.name: Love the Cowl Neck!

name: Fractal Midweight High Roller Top - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great shoes, i love it. It my 3rd speedcross 6, sole wears out quickly though(.
review.name: Great shoes

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I've been racing/trekking/adventuring in Salomon shoes since 1996.  Simply put I LOVE THEM and am a loyal customer.  I currently am working through 2 sets of SpeedCross and Ultra X - they are my go to's for every adventure.  They are the best fitting, most versatile and long lasting shoes on the market - period. 
 However the MASSIVE fail in the Speedcross is the sole -it's as slippery as all get out on rock and almost borderline negligent in how the sole just slides across wet stone.  I'm not sure what Salomon did but since 2019 that sole has been a red flag for me and has made me have to drastically slow down when getting into downhill rocky sections (nightmare when wet).  I love the shoes, am a rabid fan but seriously wish they could fix this problem.
review.name: The best design in the category BUT...
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These shoes are fantastic. They fit perfectly and I couldn't be more happy with them.
review.name: Perfect Hiking/Trail Running Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: The Salomon Speedcross 6 Gore-Tex impressed me with its excellent grip on muddy trails, waterproof Gore-Tex protection, and lightweight comfort. Its Quicklace system and precise fit made it perfect for technical terrain. A great choice for wet and challenging conditions
review.name: perfect

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Speed cross are my got to shoes. Got these to wear when wx is wetter, since they are gore-Tex
review.name: Have 4 pairs now, favorite shoes evah.

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of Speedcross Gortex (5 & 6).  I've found them to be extremely comfortable.  I have a history of plantar fasciitis and have custom orthotics as a result.  These are the only shoes that I don't use them in because of the high arch, great fit and exceptional comfort.  They treads wear down a bit faster than some shoes but the tradeoff in comfort is worth it.  I use them for hiking, walking, golf and everyday wear.
review.name: I Love These Shoes!

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Bought them wore them hate them.
I am not buying these again
review.name: Not good fit. Tight toe box, poor stability
comment: Hello, I appreciate you sharing your experience with us. We constantly work to get better! Please keep in mind that your feedback are being taken in consideration!

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I use them for every trail, I love those. Great shoes to wear specially in wet season
review.name: GREAT TRAIL SHOES

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have always loved the speed cross shoes, I have had at least 8 pairs. I particularly like this one. Very comfortable and excellent grip. My only complaint in the past is the grip wears down quickly , I hope I don’t have this issue this time. Great shoe !
review.name: Great sjie

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my daily shoe for trails that get soft and muddy with rain and they are are the most stable of the shoes I've tried.  Fit is a little snug so with a slightly wide foot you might want to go a half size up. This might be isolated to just the goretex version.
review.name: Great Trail Shoe

review.reviewBody:
Worn it twice and it is my favorite flannel of all times!
I’m 44 6’ 158lbs. Fits like a glove. The fit and finish are exceptional. I plan on wearing this often and think this will last me a long time and hold up well. I need to buy more fjallraven! If you are a slim build (trash and skinny) this is an awesome shirt!
review.name: Best flannel ever!

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing these shirts for over 3 years. The SKOG shirt is the best heavy, yet soft, flannel in the  marketplace period! The workmanship is impeccable along with superior quality and handy design. Awaiting more brighter colors in the future.
review.name: Simply the best!

review.reviewBody:
This is a great looking shirt if you are skinnier but do not trust the images for the color.  I ordered the navy and was expecting the orangish/ brown hue depicted in the photos but the actual color is much closer to red.  

I would order a size up if you are bigger than average in the arms or chest as this is slim fit with no give in the material so it may feel a bit restricting.
review.name: Great shirt but colors are not accurate

review.reviewBody: Best flannel I have ever bought hands down. I am tall and slim so flannels are generally don’t fit me great but this one is almost like it was custom tailored especially for me I couldn’t be happier
review.name: Amazing flannel

review.reviewBody:
Very nice slim fit that fits me better than any other brand I’ve tried. My chief complaint is that the bottom hem at the sides flare out a bit like a women’s blouse, it isn’t perfectly straight cut through the torso so it can look a little funny and blousey/bell shaped. Really hope Fjallraven can straighten out the hem/body on this one to dial it in fully. Overall pleased with the slim fit through the upper body and would like to see this cut in a lightweight package for warmer days and even office wear too. I would also really like some solid color choices so I’m not plaid guy all the time. 

For some sizing context I’m 5’9” 138 lbs, 29” waist and find a size small to be just right in the slim but not tight, untuckable length that’s not too long and not too short, and sleeves that cover just past the wrist.
review.name: Almost perfect. Still the best slim fit flannel.

review.reviewBody: I love the thickness of the material, organic cotton, and the slim fit, but the sleeves are too short.
review.name: Almost Perfect

review.reviewBody: No other words - I absolutely love how comfortable and warm this shirt's kept me last Winter-Spring.
review.name: My favourite flannel

review.reviewBody: This was my second Fjalraven button up. The first one was an X-LARGE and gave me plenty of room. The description said “relaxed fit” this shirt said “athletic fit”, and I thought it would still fit nice since the other one had so much room and I have a wide chest. Not the case. This shirt in XL didn’t even have the sleeve length of the other shirt and I couldn’t even get it buttoned! Had to return it for an XXL that’s also quite snug and will never be washed for fear of it shrinking even a little. It’s a nice shirt, but I sure wish it fit like the other one.
review.name: Tight Fit

review.reviewBody:
I'm 6'1.5, 190 lbs with an athetic build (wide shoulders / lats and a narrow waist) and sometimes have to buy medium in NA to get something that fits. I rolled the dice on large and it fits beautifully. 
Colors are quiet and understated. The flannel is heavy, soft, and warm. The build quality is terrific. Just a perfect shirt for Canadian winters.
review.name: Maybe perfect flannel shirt?

review.reviewBody: Very nice shirt that seemed high quality when I bought it a week and a half ago. But already I see a small rip on the sleeve. I would've expected better than that...
review.name: Already a tear

name: Skog Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody: The fabric is tough but thin and light. Nice slim fit. I wear a 36x32 and the large fits just right. The blue is a great color, not quite dark navy uniform pants but still understated.
review.name: Super comfy

review.reviewBody: These pants are so comfortable and versatile I just love them. The cotton material is cool and sturdy, and the sizing is spot on.
review.name: Best pants ever!!

review.reviewBody: Super durable ripstop, extremely comfy, and perfectly spacious for lounging about and also rock climbing.  These have a perfect amount of stretch, and I love the gusseted crotch.  I like the elastic waistband and tie around the waist if you want to cinch them up.  These are the perfect adventure pants but are also great around town.  They are spacious around the thighs and butt but not too baggy, so they are perfect for a wide range of movements.
review.name: Fantastic Adventure Pants

review.reviewBody: I have had a couple of pairs of BD pants for rope and bouldering (primarily indoors in cold gyms) and these are the best so far. They're light but strong and have the perfect amount of flexibility. Would highly recommend.
review.name: Best pants for bouldering

review.reviewBody: I bought these online and I was expecting to like them but they are seriously awesome! Super comfy and flexible, and a little thicker which will be perfect for cold fall/winter days out climbing! They also look nice enough for everyday wear.
review.name: Love these pants.

review.reviewBody: The allow great movement, light but still really tough build quality expect these to last a good while. Look awesome too.
review.name: Rocklock pants

review.reviewBody: As an individual who works a lot but also likes to dress up when going out. These pants were the perfect fit. They are rugged enough to handle adventure but stylish enough to wear throughout the town. I am 6’1 220 pounds with a 36 inch waist, athletic build and the size large fit great. They are a little snug which I don’t mind. Overall a great product for the price.
review.name: Awesome product

review.reviewBody: Brought this for my kid and he love it. The color is vibrant and the fit fachionable.
review.name: Fashionable pant

review.reviewBody: Una pieza ergonómica y a la vez robusta, sin duda una pieza recomendable para vías en las que si o si el Rose con la roca no se puede negociar...
review.name: The best purchase

review.reviewBody: Burley and casual! Nice enough to wear to work, stretchy enough for lunchtime bouldering. Light enough for hiking.
review.name: Made to live in

review.reviewBody: I love these shirts and wear daily. My only complaint is the fit varies.  Same shirts and same colors will fit totally different. Sometimes larger/more fitted thru trunk, tighter/looser on arm, longer/shorter  sleeve and shorter/longer in length.  I don’t fully understand how the same shirt can vary so widely.  Still enjoy the shirts but  I would expect a more consistent fit for the same style Otherwise solid quality.
review.name: Great quality but inconsistent fit

review.itemreviewed: Out N About III City Sneaker WP - Women's
review.reviewBody: I can only wear this in one foot unfortunately. The toe bed curves up. I have a plate and screws that prevent my big toe from moving therefore I can’t wear them. Such a disappointment. They are so comfortable and cute. I wish they made a flat soled shoe.
review.name: Almost perfect
comment: Hello Melanie, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry OUT N ABOUT™ III City Women's Sneaker didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.itemreviewed: Out N About III City Sneaker WP - Women's
review.reviewBody: Those boots didnt last even last for a few months. The sole started falling off. Im really disappointed in the quality
review.name: Low quality
comment: Hello Linasal, we want to extend our apologies concerning your experience. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.

review.itemreviewed: Out N About III City Sneaker WP - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great fit, comfort and stylish, I would wear this out in town, for conventions and more.
review.name: Great fit, comfort and stylish

review.itemreviewed: Out N About III City Sneaker WP - Women's
review.reviewBody: I wanted to love these so badly but they are without a doubt the least comfortable shoes i have ever worn. They are U shaped giving them no arch support forcing your heels back and driving the back of your ankle into the very high back lip causing bad blisters. To make things worse they are absoltely not true to size and i have typically an 8.5 and just to be safe i bought a 9 and they are as small as a size 8. I even had other people try them on just to make sure i wasnt completely crazy and they agreed. Horribly uncomfortable and not true to size. And sadly ordered them online while traveling and didnt try them on till I was back home so I am stuck with them as I dont feel it would even be fair to sell them to another person in good couscience knowing how uncomfortable they are. Very dissapointed.
review.name: Horribly uncomfortable and not true to size
comment: Hello natalihikari, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry OUT N ABOUT™ III City Women's Sneaker didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.itemreviewed: Out N About III City Sneaker WP - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are so cute. Sadly they are heavy, short and wide, with no arch support. 😢
review.name: More fun to look at than to wear
comment: Hello Leigh, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry OUT N ABOUT™ III City Women's Sneaker didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.itemreviewed: Out N About III City Sneaker WP - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great for warm rainy days when rain boots are just too hot to wear. Styles easily with skirts and dresses when work requires commuting in the rain. I purchased the same size I do for other Sorel boots and sneakers from other brands and they fit great. Lovely cool toned grey color!
review.name: Just what I needed!

review.itemreviewed: Out N About III City Sneaker WP - Women's
review.reviewBody: They look great, there’s no arch support but they are super cute
review.name: Fresh kicks

review.itemreviewed: Out N About III City Sneaker WP - Women's
review.reviewBody: The only shoe company where I am confident to buy online and I amcnever disappointed.  These are great, they feel good and give me a bit of a pep in my step!!
review.name: Awesome pair of shoes

review.itemreviewed: Out N About III City Sneaker WP - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great dress tennis shoe. Have these in all the colors.
review.name: Love them.

review.itemreviewed: Out N About III City Sneaker WP - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very cute and fashionable. More comfortable than I had anticipated based on previous reviews. I feel they do run shorter and wider than most sneakers. So, I took advice and ordered up a half size and the length fit perfectly….but a bit wide.
review.name: Happy so far!

review.reviewBody: Love! These boots go with everything, lots of compliments and Comfortable right out of the box.
review.name: Love the look and fit!

review.reviewBody: This boot is so comfortable! Don’t hesitate, this is the first boot I bought that was ankle short. I’m so glad I did it, I wear my jeans with them daily!
review.name: My Favorite EVERYDAY BOOT

review.reviewBody: SO cute and comfy! The distress on these boots are perfect.
review.name: BUY THEM!

review.reviewBody: Cute, comfortable, but very smelly. Such a potent chemical-leather odor that it makes me self conscience to wear these out. I bought the black ones. Not sure if it's the dye or all the colors smell bad? I really hope the aroma dissipates. It's been a couple weeks and it's still pretty noticeable.
review.name: Strong Smell
comment: Thank you for your feedback on this boot.  We so appreciate you taking the time to leave a review.  Please contact info@ariat.com or give us a call at 1-877-702-7428  if you need further assistance in this matter.

review.reviewBody: After looking for the perfect black boots for so long, I was so excited to get these. I loved them. The style and fit were perfect the first time I put them on. After wearing them 3 times, they’re too big. I love a perfectly worn pair of boots but it’s like these stretched a lot. They’re uncomfortable to wear now. I’m so bummed about this. If I had known they’d stretch so much, I would’ve sized down! 😭
review.name: Love the look but they stretch
comment: Thank you for your feedback on these boots. We so appreciate you taking the time to leave a review. Look out for an email from us where we can further discuss this issue. We’re here to help!

I really wanted to like these. I really did. The construction seems superb and the padding seems just right for a trail knee pad. Their sizing is way off through. By their sizing chart I should have been a medium. I read elsewhere they run small so I ordered a large. When they arrived I could barely get them up my leg- I thought I would bust the seam!

Moral of the story- order at least a size big. Maybe two.

review.reviewBody: The only reason I didn't give it five stars is it's heavy, but all plastic kayaks this size are heavy.  There were three reasons I chose this kayak over other plastic kayaks.  I plan on using it for river trips.  I thought it was a good size for that.  It's a little wider than other kayaks this length.  It has a bigger cockpit than similar kayaks, It doesn't have a hard chine, which I felt would make it more predictable.  As it turns out, it actually has a fair amount or rocker, which makes it even better for rivers.  I'd almost call this a crossover kayak.
review.name: Possibly best touring kayak for river tripping.

name: Castine 140 Kayak + Rudder

hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Tempo 6L H2O Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Just ok not worth the money. The lower strip does not fit and I am only a 34 waste male weird why?
review.name: Not worth the the money

review.reviewBody:
I've used many packs throughout the years, and as a huge fan of hydration packs, this is one of the best I've used. To start this was what I've been looking for, especially for the really hot days of summer. Not the best for tool organization (which I didn't need nor was looking for), it has just enough space for a few snacks, tools (including bike pump), wallet, and a shell.

What I needed, and hadn't found until this pack, was one that that insulated my water. There is nothing worse than warm water that's been sitting in a hydration reservoir for hours. With this Tempo 6, I had cold water throughout my 2 hour ride! Of course I added plenty of ice and still had a bit when the ride was over. The 3D reservoir was easy to disconnect, fill, and pack. The handle is a game changer. Kudos to the designers who thought through all the little details.

Pack construction is excellent and it was very comfortable to wear. I also love the color and design. Well executed all the way around.

I plan on using this as my main hydration pack going forward and can't wait to get back out on the bike!
review.name: Cold water at last!

review.reviewBody: Fantastic design! It looks terrific, very light and comfortable! The charcoal color is very nice!
review.name: Great backpack

name: Tempo 6L H2O Pack

review.reviewBody: On my $6500 XC ride I had 2 piston Sram brakes.  I thought they were good, however, the new 4 piston XT are much better - more control with noticeably better stopping power.  Very impressed. And, and I am not an enduro or downhill rider, yet, these are still a much better option for XC and all around. Thanks CC.
review.name: Better than expected

review.reviewBody: Had them for a month and the 4 piston brakes are great on the E-bike.  Shimano's work great but not the easiest with cables/hoses running through the frame.  I had to bleed a few times.
review.name: They set the Standard

review.reviewBody: When I bought my Levo SL Comp, it came with Sram Guide R brakes and levers. I know they are lower end Sram brakes but I was completely dissatisfied with them. So since I've always used Shimano XT or XTRs  I bit the bullit  and got the XT 8120s. OH my, what a difference. Even though the Srams were 4 piston brakes there is no comparison to the Shimano 4 piston XT 8120s. I would rate these 5 stars and just as good as the XTRs plus a heck of a lot less expensive. I highly recommend them, even at full price.
review.name: Fantastic Brakes!

review.reviewBody: What's up with Shimano these days?  Because I love these brakes.  But I would love them much more if I could find replacement pads for them.  They are non-existent...
review.name: Replacement Pads

review.reviewBody: I love these brakes...XT works just fine, no need to buy XTR.
review.name: Use these to stop

name: XT BR-M8120 Disc Brake

review.reviewBody: I ordered this because my existing straw hat, which I've been wearing for several years was very hot on a 100 degree day on the river.  This is one is great; ventiliation is excellent, and the fit is perfect.  Not to mention the cord which keeps it out of the water in a wind.  Excellent hat.
review.name: Beat summer heat

review.reviewBody: There is just something about this hat.   As soon as I put it on,  I fell in love with.   The straw is smooth and supple.   The air holes in it make it less hot.  Love the contrast of the light straw with the dark brown accents.      Chin cord makes it functional on windy days.   Would say it runs about true to size.  I have a small head, and purchased the small but put a hat size adjuster in it to tighten it up.   Wish more hat manufacturers made xs hats, as I think most of the hats are unisex sizing.     This is my first stetson hat, and I am now a fan.    Liked this hat so much,  I purchased a second one.
review.name: My favorite  hat

review.reviewBody: I previously had the Tanta, and while it wasn't a bad shoe, the Arai works for me so much better. It is a bit softer, more flexible and will stretch out a bit to mold to your foot. Even thought it is softer, it still provides good support in the midfoot. The Tanta is fully lined in cotton, so it doesn't stretch. But the Arai is only cotton on the foot bed, and microfiber/unlined in the upper, so it stretches beautifully. The Arai is comfortable right out of the box - no blisters and minimal breaking in. It is a great intermediate shoe (I climb V3 for the most part) and see myself sticking with this at least until I reach V5. All around excellent shoe. For reference, I sized down about a half size and it fits perfectly.
review.name: Will buy this again

review.reviewBody: I wear a US Men's 13.5/14 narrow in street shoes and it's hard to find good shoes. These are PERFECT for me in a 12.5 - A little tight at first but they will stretch enough to be great long-term. If you have trouble with big feet like me, give these a try
review.name: Best intermediate shoes

name: Arai Climbing Shoe

I’ve skied with my Sequence OTG goggles on multiple days on the mountain and they’ve been comfortable and fit well. review.reviewBody: I bought these earlier this season and just came back to buy a second pair! Love them. Great visibility across a variety of conditions. Not all of us are blessed with great vision. Wearing glasses and skiing shouldn't be incompatible, however. These goggles go a long way to making a ski day a success. They integrate perfectly with my Smith helmet. I did find that the goggles had to "work in" a bit so they didn't pull my glasses off when I took my goggles off. But I quickly dialed them in by Day 2. Well done, Smith team!
review.name: My favorite Over-the-Glasses goggles yet

review.reviewBody: Works well with my Smith helmet and fits comfortably over my glasses.  Can't wait to take them to the slopes.

review.reviewBody: Slipper should be able to slip on. I am a size 11 in everything and have broken the Ugg slippers in and they still cannot slip on. I need a shoe horn.
review.name: Did not fit to size

review.reviewBody: My last pair of Ugg slippers were a men's size 12, they were a bit tight so I just collapsed the heal and wore them like a slide. The material was nice, and the style was as well. However, When I just ordered a new pair I decided to size up to a 13, which was too large. I gave them to my son who wears a 13/14 and they worked for him. I am now hesitant to order a 12. I hate having to return purchases.
review.name: I would, but I would order my actual size.

review.reviewBody: I love these as house shoes. Since I work from home, I wear them all day. Had to replace the old ones that wore out and did not notice that they are no longer 100% wool lined, but are mostly plastic wool. I wear them with socks. I started noticing a stink and it turned out to be my feet! Switched to my 100% shearling mini boots and no more stink. Bring back the real lining for these slippers!!!!!
review.name: Fake shearling=sweaty and stinky feet

review.reviewBody: I wear them all the time outside n in when I come home from work I put them on
review.name: I reccomend these

review.reviewBody: I ordered the suede finish by mistake to replace my 3-year-old leather ascots. However, delighted with my purchase.

review.name: Absolutely

review.name: This one never goes wrong! Ascot is the best model

review.reviewBody: Most comfortable slippers in the market. Somewhat expensive in this economy.
review.name: Very nice!

review.reviewBody: I wear these around the house and for stepping outside briefly. Very comfortable and appear to be durable.
review.name: Recommended

review.reviewBody: I like the product. True to size. I would prefer that the rubber sole be extended by about 2mm around the base. I can feel the rubber sole in my foot.

review.reviewBody: super comfortable and stretchy! I got the 6, could have gone down to the 4, like I have in most Carve pants, but the 6 is great too!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super comfortable thanks to that little bit of stretch, not too heavy, true to size, exactly as shown. I basically live in bibs & this is my first pair of yours. I’m going to need more of them!
review.name: Exactly as shown. Perfect.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have not worn overalls since college years in the late 90s! These are so comfortable and stylish. Such a great fit that does not make you look dumpy. Absolutely love to wear them!
review.name: Cutest overall!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought two of these at once, a denim and a cord pair, and I'm so pleasantly surprised, as they are my first overalls in decades. I can wear them all day, they are super soft and comfortable. The denim is forgiving and I can sit down and climb into my camper and they stretch with me. I like them rolled up on the leg, they're cute and comfy! I'm a size 4 in Carve and that's what I got and they fit great.
review.name: Good even for longer torso

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These overalls are just what I was looking for- soft, comfortable and stretchy! They are true to size and look great on!
review.name: Soft and Comfy!

review.reviewBody: Super comfy & cute. Love them! Got a size 10 & they are a little roomie but like that in an overall.
review.name: Cute overalls

review.reviewBody: The softest overalls I’ve ever owned. The fabric is medium/thin as in thickness. I am 6’0” 127lbs. and bought the size 4. If they unrolled they hit about 2” above the around for reference. They are the perfect fit. Not too loose, not to baggy.
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: Love these. Super comfy and cute. Got them for the fall season to wear out and about. Fun!
review.name: Really cool Overalls

description: Buy the Eureka! Timberline SQ 2XT Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Timberline SQ 2XT Tent: 2-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Eureka! Timberline SQ 2XT Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great for Florida camping, easy to assemble and take down. Roomy enough for two but I tested it on my own and it provides plenty of room for one. The fly kept the rain out very well.
review.name: A Great Companion For My Timberline 6 Person Tent

review.reviewBody: A really great tent. Easy to set up. Good in bad weather. Durable. This will my third Timberline tent since 1995. They do get old. After 15 years, the polyurethane coating tends to perish. That is a really good lifespan in this throwaway age. So sad that Johnson Outdoors are quitting the brand.
review.name: Best tent I ever had

review.reviewBody: Easy to set up, good quality tent. Redesigned zippers don’t allow for easy air flow in and out of the tent. Overall would recommend.

Had tent over 10 years, use it in all 4 seasons. Love how sturdy it is when put up, love the vestibule size, love the headroom. 

Downside is, it uses a lot of stakes for even setting up in light rain (minimum 10, 4-tent corners, 4-fly/vestibule corners, 2- fly sides). So the tent is free standing-ish, but only if you have room to get all the stakes in. Also the fly ends use small loose poles, begging to be lost and requiring a lot of extra attention. Similarly there is a reinforcing tube for the center span and a tiny delicate pole for spreading the tent/fly mid-span. That's (4) loose poles about 12" long to keep track of and not damage. All interfacing in plastic hubs.
review.name: Sturdy - Takes Time To Assemble

review.reviewBody: Love this tent. Hope Eureka sticks around and continues to make great products

I was given a 2 person Timberline as a graduation present in 1984 and used it heavily until 2019 when I finally replaced it with a Timberline SQ. Although I had to replace the fly once on the old tent, the only problem was the zipper in the door, which I couldn't figure out how to fix, or else I would have gladly kept using it.  That said, I love my new SQ.  I especially love how much easier it is to set up, which I often have to do after dark.  I also love the extra head room provided by the cross bar over the top of the frame.  Although I was skeptical at first of the mostly screen sides, I have camped in it at temps below freezing and was fine.  I should note also that I tried two other tents before I got the Timberline SQ, both of which made me wonder why anyone would choose anything except for a Timberline in this size category.

There are just two things I would change about it if I were to do a redesign: 1) I would change the window zippers in the doors such that you can keep a triangle (of whatever size you like) open at the top.  A previous reviewer made the same comment.  With the current design you can adjust the size of the opening side ways, but that does not allow one to keep the wind off your body and see out the window at the same time.  Also, the window doesn't tend to stay half open with the current design.  It is either all or nothing. 2) I would like a better mechanism for typing back the flaps of the vestibule when it is not open.  Currently there's a flap in that hangs down in the middle, which is annoying if you're trying to get in and out that end when it is wet.  Not a huge problem, since I usually go in and out the other end anyway, but I would imagine one that the tent designers could figure out. 3) Although I primarily use my tent for car camping, if the same design could be made out of lighter materials, especially for the poles, it would be great for backpacking too.
review.name: I love my new Timberline!

review.reviewBody: I wanted a tent that would fit out ATV 6x10' trailer and not have to sleep in the dirt and this is perfect. Love how it sets up and the doors on each side make this easy to access. Haven't had to try it in rain yet but planned on a rain tarp anyway to keep the pine sap off. Easy set up and take down.
review.name: Love the A-Frame design

review.reviewBody: My granddaughter has taken up outdoor activities in college. Felt she needed a better quality tent than the college supplies. I had a Timberline 4 person years ago and familiar with Eureka quality.
review.name: Spacious two person.

review.reviewBody:
Used once at the beach in 15-20 mph wind and light rain. 
Did great, no leaks and tent maintained it’s shape in the wind. 
Very happy with its performance. 

Only suggestion: I would prefer both ends have the vestibule facing the same direction so you can use it at either end depending on camp and wind direction.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: I bought this town about a month ago for my son who is in scouts. We went camping for the weekend and it drizzled all weekend. There was not a drop of water in the tent!!!!The new design of the timberline SQ2 is awesome!
review.name: Awesome Tent!!!!

name: Timberline SQ 2XT Tent: 2-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: Found this one to be kind of blah flavor wise.  Didn't taste bad, just kind of didn't taste at all
review.name: Didn't hate it

review.reviewBody: It was ok. Not my favorite flavors. Slightly bland in comparison to other meals.
review.name: It was ok. Slightly bland.

review.reviewBody: We love other Mountain House flavors but this one was terrible.
review.name: Not a Good Flavor

review.reviewBody: Was pleasantly impressed with this one!  Minor problem with the bag sealing after adding water but out there you learn to improvise.  Delicious
review.name: A delicious new, to me, flavor

review.reviewBody: I’ve been taking young men on 50 mile hike for the past 25 year and Mountain House is our favorite. I’ve never been disappointed in the quality and taste.
review.name: Delicious

review.reviewBody: Don't buy the other cheaper brands! You pay for what you get. i have tried other brands and Mountain House is superior to most others. I will be buying more in the future.
review.name: WOW

review.reviewBody:
Some Mountain House meals are so good that you would eat them at home and be perfectly happy because they're delicious.  Others, like this one, taste better the more hungry and cold you are.  

If you were cold and hungry and some-one offered you this meal, I guarantee you would be overjoyed and deeply grateful.  And it would taste delicious.  If you're sitting in your nice warm kitchen though, it might just taste acceptable.
review.name: A little disappointing, but still very edible

review.reviewBody:
Great taste, better than some restaurants.
A lot of good food for two people to eat.
Thanks
review.name: Chicken Fried Rice

review.reviewBody: This meal is one of the best camp meals which I have ever tasted. The chicken has substance and does not have a hint of that dry cardboardy taste. I eat the whole bag at the end of the long trail-day. It is more than filling. Some powdered soy sauce is a great addition. I have a keychain Sriracha bottle for those times when I need an extra dab of spice. Tip: Use super hot boiling water, I mean really get it boiling. Then, stick to the MH directions. It comes out perfect.
review.name: Really dang darn good!

review.reviewBody: It finishes up as more of a slurry/liquid texture and not  like a drier fried rice. Taste was OK but it needs a good dose of soy sauce for my taste. Take some soy sauce along in your backpack for this one.
review.name: just ok

name: Chicken Fried Rice
