description: Buy the Fjallraven Abisko Summer Hat - Men's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Abisko Summer Hat - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Abisko Summer Hat - Men's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Perfect hat for full sun coverage, great materials, proper fit, and doesn’t get too hot in the sun on my head either.
review.name: Great summer hat!

review.reviewBody: I'm always searching for a lightweight cloth hat that has a stiffer brim the typical cloth boonie hats.  This hat fulfills that need. Notes:  1. Buy slightly loose because it will shrink slightly after 1 wash in warn water and normal machine dry.  2. This hat is hot on a summer day-no ventilation in the crown and you'll notice it.
review.name: Good but hot in summer; will shrink slightly.

review.reviewBody: I bought this hat in M initially and had to upgrade to L. But the Blue I have in L is great. I wear it on almost every hike I take. Helps keep sun off and rain off my glasses, is not floppy and has held up beautifully. I think I need one in Buckwheat now...
review.name: Favorite hiker hat!

review.reviewBody: It's a nice hat. Looks very good, but I think the material of choice on the top isn't that best. It's rather thick, which makes it not very breathable and it gets very hot in it. Could barely wear it on a hot day hiking as I was overheating. Wish it was lighter material
review.name: Not breathable, warm

review.reviewBody: Ok hat, but the rain soaks right in after about 2 minutes. I wouldn't call it water-resistant or fast-drying.
review.name: Not good at all for rain

review.reviewBody: I purchased this hat according to the size chart and my measurement is  22”  so I ordered a medium which is 22”-23”.  It was smaller than expected and fit tighter than I wanted it to. Perhaps it would stretch out, but I was not willing to chance it and returned it.
review.name: Sizing a little smaller than expected

review.reviewBody: Junk. Every seam is crooked, the snaps are half an inch off from eachother, the logo is crooked, the cord is sewn in crooked, and the size is mislabeled...it is absolute garbage.
review.name: Don't waste your money.

review.reviewBody: Dark olive colour turned brown after one wear in the sun.
review.name: Colour change

review.reviewBody: I bought this hat for a recent backpacking trip in the Eastern Sierras and it performed admirably. It's comfortable, breathes easy and did quite well in a bit of snow despite the G1000 fabric containing cotton. What I like most is that the brim stays stiff and does not flop around. I used to hike and camp in a ball cap, but I will now use this for all of my outdoor activities.
review.name: Well-rounded Hat

review.reviewBody: I love this hat! I have had multiple cases of skin cancer ( all removed) so I have been looking for a hat that will block the sun yet not be too big. This one does the job for sure... has held up well in salt and freshwater and I often use it when I work on my property... They did it again.
review.name: Blocks the Sun - Does the Job

name: Abisko Summer Hat - Men's

review.reviewBody: Solid bag that will be seeing a lot miles in the coming months
review.name: Durable + Sleek!

review.reviewBody: For a while I was looking for a backpack that was water resistant and sturdy , could carry my laptop in a protective way (the same way the borealis do) and was large enough to fit my Wacom cintiq 16 with it's protective case inside. And this backpack has been perfect to fit these requirements , it's spacious enough to fit the tablet with it protective case , cable , my cooling pad for my computer , has an elevated spacious computer compartment so I can put my bag on the floor with no worries and has a slick design that I love from the north face backpacks. I am so happy to be able to now bring my whole setup with me to college or in a plane when I travel in a confortable way in a proper backpack. For référence for my computer it is an Aero 15 oled and it fit with a lot of space still. My only critic would be that If they added straps on the side to be able the compress your backpack that would be a great addition when you transport clothes
review.name: Perfect backpack for my computer setup

review.reviewBody: Gifting this to my Son! He travels alot for work and also lives in a different state than we do. Going to be great for traveling!
review.name: It's Perfect!

review.reviewBody: Took it with me for my 2-week trip to Japan. It held all my items, and I don't know how but it was surprisingly light weight despite being packed to the max with clothes and bottles of various cosmetics. I definitely recommend purchasing this item if traveling.
review.name: Get the Bag!

review.reviewBody: This is a fantastic very well designed bag. I use it for one-bag travel and really appreciate its useful organization. The material and construction seems to be less robust than the Surge backpacks I've used for years, but it still works great.
review.name: Great for one bag travel

review.reviewBody: This is my primary travel backpack on flights and road trips. The 35L olive color is comfortable, has ample space, and looks good. Ordered thru the TNF site with no issues in delivery. The materials have held up and I appreciate that the pack is able to stay upright when placed on a flat surface.
review.name: Get this travel bag

review.reviewBody: Great bag with great functionality and versatility. Durable material just like other base camp bags, but the voyager material is slightly less stiff. I prefer the top-down opening, rather than the clamshell side opening, which is a main reason why I chose this bag. And I appreciate the separate compartments for storing smaller items rather than just having one large main compartment.
review.name: Durable, versatile, functional

review.reviewBody: Great capacity, versatility and durability. I prefer the top down opening rather than the clamshell side opening that is a main reason why I chose this bag. The handles on each side are useful and the separate pockets make this more utilizable than a bag with just one main compartment.
review.name: Durable, versatile, functional

review.reviewBody: This backpack is amazing, spacious but not bulky. Beautuful design, can hold a large water bottle, and you can put it on top of a suitcase and roll it. The large padded compartment holds my laptop and tablet perfectly. I had orginially purchased a popular travel backpack from another company (in 2 different sizes), but ended up returning them to get this one. I could not be happier. Just took it on a trip to Australia and it was perfect!
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: The bag is built so sturdy. I can't wait to use it for travel.
review.name: The best

name: Base Camp Voyager L Daypack

review.reviewBody: These are the only shoes my 19 year old wants to wear. They had a pair that lasted 2 years and unfortunately those snapped at the back by the Velcro. I immediately purchased the exact same pair, but after only having them for a week they broke in the same place. 3 stars because they are comfortable sandals and a great color. Just disappointed.
review.name: The best shoes, but breaking point

review.reviewBody: I bought a second pair, same color. This is not because there is anything wrong with the sandal. I've run down the tread from constant use in my pool but they are otherwise in perfect shape. I bought a second pair to use as a second pair of footwear on a hiking trip. So comfortable and lightweight.
review.name: 2nd pair of Hurricane Drifts

review.reviewBody: The first pair was so comfortable that I ordered a 2nd pair in a different color.
review.name: Super comfy!

review.reviewBody: The product is great except for the sizing. Women's 9 is too long and Women's 8 is too short.
review.name: Need half sizes!!

review.reviewBody: I'm usually not a fan of sandals, I almost always wear sneakers everywhere. I also have wide, flat feet but these are great! Very light and my feet can spread comfortably while feeling secure. These were shipped super fast and I got them the next day! Really happy with this purchase and overall experience. Will definitely be buying more products again :)
review.name: Exceeded expectations!

review.reviewBody: I love Teva sandals but these are the worst shoes ive ever worn.. soooo uncomfortable. Hard plastic cutting into your feet, no cushion on the sole.. & the sizing, i ordered by the size guide & measurements but had over 1½ inch empty sandal along with the stiff as a board straps hovering well above my feet.. they didnt even come close to touching the top of my foot. And to give Teva the benefit of doubt, i tried the sandals on & walked into ankle deep water at the lake.. 1 sandal came off as i twisted my ankle trying to walk on the wet, slick as glass hard plastic footbed. Do yourself a favor & find a store that carries these & try them on before you buy... dont purchase online
review.name: These are the most uncomfortable shoes if ever owned

review.reviewBody: Originally I got size 8 (I normally wear 8.5 or 9 in shoes). They were too big/loose so I exchanged them for 7s. Those fit perfectly with length and width. They look super cute but you CANNOT walk in them. I took them to Spain/Portugal where I knew I'd be walking a lot. First day they immediately hurt after 30 mins of walking. The problem is the top strap. It would rub against the side of my foot below my big toe and started a blister. Unfortunately couldn't wear them. Not worth the money for them to be so painful.
review.name: Save your money- causes blister

review.reviewBody: I wear these in the rain and to the pool. Don't have to worry about water stain, damage.
review.name: Love the Hurricane Drift!

review.reviewBody: I'm recommending them to everyone I can. They're so comfy I did order down a size per recommendations from the comments
review.name: Love!!

review.reviewBody: I have arthritis in my feet -haven't worn sandals for years -these are great for me
review.name: Teva

name: Hurricane Drift Sandal - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought these about a month ago and I’ve been wearing them for work (I’m a liftie) and they are amazing! They’re keeping me warm and dry and aren’t showing any wear yet! I’ve worn them 4 days a week for 9+ hours a day for the past 3-4 weeks and they still look brand new. They’re comfy and they have the adjustable waistband so I adjust them based on the layers I’m wearing underneath. review.reviewBody:
This sweater is dense, heavy, and warm, and somehow the wool is still flexible and soft. The turtle collar is soft against your neck - I don't have to wear an unde-rlayer that goes up that high.  It's still wool, though, so if your skin is really sensitive, you might have to.

The wool isn't super thick, it's just knit very densely.  It's a really solid, satisfying-feeling sweater.  The texture pattern is also unique and subtle and really cool.

I have the natural white color, and it looks a little lighter in real life than it looks in the pics online.  It's not quite white, but it's by far the brightest shade of off-white out of several off-white and ecru sweaters that I have.

I'm just a hair short of 6'4" and 195 lbs with long torso and arms, and size Large fits great.  The sleeves come down to the heel of my hand (and the cuffs are already folded over, so I could make them a little longer even if I needed to).  The bottom of the sweater goes down just a couple inches below the top of my pants.  It's not a long sweater that hangs way down, it's a little shorter, fisherman style.  Most of the other sweaters this company makes ARE pretty long, though.  I guess they gotta fit those tall Danish dudes.  I have a few sweaters made by these guys, and they're all pretty great.
review.name: Dense, heavy, amazing sweater

name: Fisherman Sweater - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I love these shoes, I am a mailman and i wear them everyday and only one stud has fallen out so far.  they do run a bit big.  But my feet stay dry and my performance on ice is spectacular and the tread is still good.  

the only negative is one shoelace has ripped to where the white chord inside and now I am trying to find the right shoelace to replace and am having a hard time finding a shoelace that will be compatible.  These laces are not wide in diameter so I am not wanting to buy tons of laces.  wish icebug sold laces on their site.  

outside of the shoelaces these shoes are outstanding, i walk on average 10 to 14 miles a day in these and they hold up.
review.name: icebug adak shoes

review.reviewBody: It is so difficult to find winter boots with toe boxes large enough that my feet don't feel squished.   These toe-boxes are plenty big for thick winter socks - which was wonderful.  However, nowhere in the description did it mention that the treads had tiny little metal spikes in them.  I suppose a great feature if you're going to wear them in snow & ice.  Not what I was looking for though.
review.name: Nice roomy toe box

review.reviewBody: I commute a short distance to/from work (~6 miles round trip). I hated wearing my backpack on hot summer days. I bought this basket and it easily attached to a pretty low-end back rack and works like a champ! my backpack fits right in and I secure with a 12in bungee cord that easily hooks on to the side lattice work on the basket. It's light, so doesn't add much weight. 10 out of 10, would buy again, but hopefully it holds up for 10+ years :)
review.name: 10 out of 10

review.reviewBody:
I had been using an old crate so this is definitely an upgrade in the looks department. It's well built and easily attached to my Surly 24-pack front rack. The mounting isn't difficult, but seems more complicated than it needs to be.

My only beef is that the dimensions are a little misleading as it's slightly tapered so something that might fit in the top won't go all the way to the bottom. A minor quibble - but worth noting.

Overall, I'm happy and will likely get a second one for my other bike.
review.name: She's a looker.

review.reviewBody: I have been surprised and quite pleased at this basket. The size is Impressive. Holds my large hiking backpack along with water bottles for my family of 6. The stability is fantastic. I took maybe 10 minutes to install and have only wanted to add more to ever one of my children’s bikes now as well.
review.name: Yes, great basket for storage.

review.reviewBody: I bought the Pack n Pedal for my son's ebike and we like it so much we are getting 2 more for our other bikes.  It is sturdy but not heavy and the slates make it easy to bungy stuff in.  It is worth the money.  FYI people frequently see it and ask where to get one.
review.name: Love this soo much I am buying 2 more.

review.reviewBody: Easy to install, durable, well-balanced , holds a ton
review.name: Sturdy cargo carrier for back of bike

review.reviewBody: Love this basket for my dog to ride with me. I use a snap hook to keep her stationary. She will ride for hours. 15 lb dog.
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: Works perfectly with Aventon Sinch factory rear rack. Didn't need anything special to mount, and basket feels strong!
review.name: Works great with Aventon Sinch Rear Rack

review.reviewBody: I received my Thule Pack 'n Pedal Basket about a week ago.  The instillation took a few minutes, but once finished the basket looked great and held tight to my rear bike rack.  It's a good size basket, not too big, not too small, just right.  Took my bicycle with new basket to the grocery store for a test trip.  The basket made no noise and worked perfectly!
review.name: Thule Pack 'n Pedal Basket

review.reviewBody:
Great Quality....one of the barrel nuts turned out to be defective...no threads!
only discovered after  1 1/2 hours upside down trying to install that one bolt. 
worth it in the end. my back still hurts  :)
review.name: Perfect....little finicky to install

review.reviewBody: I've had this Pack and Pedal basket/rack system for quite sometime.   Use is mostly when I want to take my dog (14lbs) with me, which is often.   The ability to use it on any bike and any location is ideal for me.   Now that we have two dogs.. I'm buying a second system.  one for the front and one for the back.
review.name: My dog carrier

review.itemreviewed: Bushido II GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my 3rd pair of the Bushido 2 but the 1st Gore-Tex version. Had to pull the trigger when BC went super low on the pricing. As with all La Sport shoes it helps to try them on which is difficult leading to negative reviews on sizing. Size chart I'm a 44 so that's what I went w/. Returned for 44.5, still too small. Ordered the 45 and they are fantastic! Great grip, comfortable for my foot, med. width, med. volume type foot. IMO they look cool too. Super protective upper, and major stability for technical off-trail fun. The only down side to the Gore-Tex is it doesn't breathe like the non-GT version but its fall, heading into winter so that part doesn't bother me at all. Waterproofing is what you would expect from the GT. Ordering was quick and easy per usual with BC. If I see them again anywhere near the price I paid, I would scoop them up again!
review.name: 3rd pair is still in love

review.itemreviewed: Bushido II GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I am a great fan of La Sportiva shoes.  I have a slightly narrow foot and need good arch support.  La Sportiva shoes seem to fit me consistently well with good support where needed and excellent comfort.
review.name: Sold on La Sportiva

review.itemreviewed: Bushido II GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Such a great shoe!! Multiple half dome summits, did the Inca Trail to Machu Pichu in them. I’m on my 3rd pair over the course of a few years and will continue to buy as long as they are in production. Beware they are undersized for USA buyers.
review.name: Repeat Buyer

review.itemreviewed: Bushido II GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Toe box is cramped. Shoes run small and do not break in. I wish I could return them bc they are unwearable for me.
review.name: Terrible fit

review.itemreviewed: Bushido II GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: i first replace to speed lace on my new La Sportiva. Took it out for 5 miles trail run. Felt great, the sole felt very supportive....dont feel a thing runnung over rocks or branches.
review.name: Sturdy Sole

name: Bushido II GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Trollveggen GORE-TEX PRO Light Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: So far I have only used this hardshell for a winter ascent if mt Washington.  Winds 40-50mph, but warm with temps in low 30F.  This is my first product from norrona, so far I am pleased.  I am 160lbs 5’ 10” and the M fits just right. Plenty comfortable with a light fleece and still enough room to put over my heavier down parka.  I really like the long cut and coverage of the back of your hands and on your back side.  The zippers for pockets and pitch zips are outstanding and work flawlessly.  The hood only has one size adjustment and took a bit if getting used too.  But it worked well once adjusted and there are no free straps to flap in the wind and do damage to your face.  Is it worth the price, time will tell.  But so far I am very pleased
review.name: Well designed and functional

review.itemreviewed: Trollveggen GORE-TEX PRO Light Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Lives up to its top reviews. Solid zippers, good hood adjustments, wall-shaped cuffs. Excellent fit with room for midlayer. Completely weatherproof in rain and snow.
review.name: Head of the Class

review.itemreviewed: Trollveggen GORE-TEX PRO Light Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I wore the Norrona on a three-week trip to Ireland in the fall. This jacket rejected hours of rain each day, and left me comfortable and dry.

Fits true to size and allows one to wear a midlayer fleece underneath. Would appear to be a good option in snowy conditions as well.
review.name: Excellent jacket for rainy conditions

name: Trollveggen GORE-TEX PRO Light Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought a Difesa cap (in effect, Difesa 1, not Difesa 1). It fit nicely over the ears.  But, although billed as one-size-fits-all, it was too small for me --- hat size 7 1/4. The problem is the rigid bill. If the hat is too small for you, the hat pulls the rigid edge of the bill into your forehead. For me, after 15 minutes, it was uncomfortable, and before long I had a headache.
review.name: Not really one-size-fits-all

description: Buy the Platypus Big Zip EVO Lumbar Reservoir online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Big Zip EVO Lumbar Reservoir
hasVariant.description: Buy the Platypus Big Zip EVO Lumbar Reservoir online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Old big ZIP was better easier to clean. New bags are terrible. Who ever designed this should be fired.
review.name: Old Big Zip was better

review.reviewBody: My reservoir was delivered two days before my backpacking trip and arrived with a small hole in it. This caused it to leak and resulted in the inability to use it during my backpacking trip. I was extremely disappointed in the fact that it arrived in this poor condition because I specifically bought this because it was supposed to be a good brand. I tried calling the number for the website and no one ever answered so I am very displeased and will not make another purchase from this company.
review.name: I am very displeased

review.reviewBody: Purchased a 3L and loved it…..until the bite valve came off and we found that the bite valve & shut off valve were filled with some sort of gel-like substance. Can’t even remotely clean it out. Searched for info on what it is, and can’t figure out what it is. SO disappointed.
review.name: Confused

review.reviewBody: I have used various Platypus units since they first hit the market. I got a 2L Evo as my Big Zip SL developed a small hole at the bottom. I put this in my bag and into the boot of the car. Ninety minutes later most of the water was in my rucksack or the car. The top seal is hopeless even with the poorly fitting blue “handle”. Water pours out. Useless. What have you done Platypus?
review.name: Non sealing

review.reviewBody: I loved the 3L big zip LP with the platypus bag. I told myself I’d never buy another brand. But now platypus has changed their bladder and it does not fit properly in their old bag. And to make matters worse they don’t even sell bags anymore to fit their new EVO packs. This company has gone downhill fast.
review.name: Bring back old platypus

review.reviewBody: I bought one of these on the 18th of June for my son to use on his Duke of Edinburgh bronze expedition. I've had Platypus products before so I know they are good quality. However I'm disappointed with this one. The reservoir and the tubing are very good and there really is no bad taste. but the shut-off valve is a poor design. My son was out in the wild for less than two days and the shut-off valve fell out of the tube and was lost. It's easy to see how it would fall out as it only has one ridge on the bayonet that goes into the tube; all the other fittings have two or three ridges and they seem to be wider so they will 'dig in' more to the side of the tube. In terms of design this has to be either an oversight or a petty attempt at cost-saving. It's a shame, because now I either risk buying a Platypus valve that might get lost, or try one from a random factory in China that has three ridges, but might not be food safe.
review.name: Shut-off valve a weakness

review.reviewBody: Really happy with the bladder. The flow is much better than other brands I have used. I'm wondering if there is a recommended length of time before it's suggested to buy a new one to avoid any plastic leaching into the water?
review.name: Happy Customer

review.reviewBody: After having a slight issue with my big zip Evo I was contacted by customer services and it was swiftly replaced. Have to say it was probably the best customer service I've ever received and I will definitely be purchasing more products in the future. Thanks very much platypus.
review.name: Customer service

review.reviewBody:
In general I am happy with the bladder, no leaks and tasted good from the start so quite happy. 
Main bad point is the centre baffle has come apart at the bend so it fills like one big balloon. I should have returned it at the time but I thought it was a feature and I could re attach it whenever I wanted to, but now that I want to I've discovered it doesn't re attach. I'm sure I remember something about expanding it for more volume,but can't find anything on it now, and now it takes up to much room in my new bag so it's a bit useless. 
I like it apart from that tho but can't rate higher as can't use ot.
 I only use water in it so cleaning easy
review.name: Centre baffle split?

review.reviewBody: The bladders themselves have been durable over the years I have used them. The updated ON/OFF valves are not robust and break easily.
review.name: ON/OFF valve not very durable

name: Big Zip EVO Lumbar Reservoir

review.itemreviewed: Los Gatos Crew Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: High warmth sweater. The pile is cozy. The crew neck allows for it to be layered easily. The only issue with sizing is that the arms are a little long. Torso feels like other Patagonia mediums to me.
review.name: Great crew neck

review.itemreviewed: Los Gatos Crew Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I bought this item based on the size of the reviewers who bought this gear.  Few gears I already bought here, Patagonia and Marmot gears, are all large.  So, I was worried of the fit in buying this item and basing of the reviewers sizes which bought M, I followed sought as 5'6", 150 lbs.
The fit was small for me in buying Medium.  I  should have stayed with my size- Large.  Other than that these items as I already have some Patagonia and Marmot, could have been a good addition for my needs.
I am returning this gear.
review.name: Watch out for the reviews...

review.itemreviewed: Los Gatos Crew Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I usually take a Patagonia medium and this fits to a T, despite many reviews indicating it is cut small.  Some may find the style quirky - a crew with hand warmer pockets but it's exactly what I was looking for as the mid-layer jackets and half-zips tend to crowd the neck in some shell jackets, making it a struggle to close them all the way up - kind of important in foul weather.  I lamented the demise of the simple Micro-D crew they used to offer but this so far looks to be an improvement on it.
review.name: Great fit and design

review.itemreviewed: Los Gatos Crew Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I am M in all of the Patagonia stuff that I owe and some of the items I have fit me in Small size. This product doesn’t make any sense. Medium fits really small on me.  Now I have to return it and go through the whole process.  Kinda disappointed!!
review.name: Odd fit

review.itemreviewed: Los Gatos Crew Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I just bought a second one!  So like everyone is saying, if you want a more loose fit, size up.  I am a size S and i think it fits perfectly but then again, I prefer the slim look (150lb - 5'9).  Overall this is a great sweatshirt/sweater and you can't go wrong with it, especially when it's on sale.  Like I said, i bought one initially and loved it so much that I got another one.
review.name: Wonderfully warm!

review.itemreviewed: Los Gatos Crew Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'm 5'11" 180lbs. Super average size man. I have tried all the sizes and none of them fit right. The medium is crazy tight, the large fits the best but is a terrible fit and the XL is massive on me. I'm looking for just a cozy jacket to lounge around camp so I don't have high expectations for form fitting. I just think Patagonia has lost it's way or are catering to very overweight odd shaped individuals.
review.name: Really odd sizing

review.itemreviewed: Los Gatos Crew Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I really like it but I would definitely suggest ordering a size up. I had to buy a second and return the first because it didn't fit well and there was such low stock. Usually a L needed an XL
review.name: Runs small but really nice

review.itemreviewed: Los Gatos Crew Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Normally ordering anything from Patagonia I would always get a medium and without fail it fits perfect, like a glove. This time this garment that's a medium fits ok but looks off, like it's too tight/small around the torso so I would suggest maybe sizing up from your normal size.

Other then that I would highly recommend this fleece that will be in my go bag when traveling as it's snug, warm and comfortable which is perfect for just chilling around the hills and lounge with friends and family.
review.name: Unusual Sizing From Patagonia

review.itemreviewed: Los Gatos Crew Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have about a dozen garments in Patagonia medium that all fit. This one fits nothing like a medium. It fits like an extra small. Patagonias consistency across sizing really sucks these days as I’ve had the same problem with the P-6 hoody. Quality is fine but the fit is just bizarre. I can’t imagine this fitting anyone
review.name: Bizarre fit. Way too small

review.itemreviewed: Los Gatos Crew Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Not sure how to describe it….  Fits strange and looks odd.  My wife hates it on me.  I’m too lazy to send it back and it is warm.  I kind of like it but would NEVER buy again.  Also, I’m 99% satisfied with any Patagonia gear I’ve bought in the past.  Just don’t do it…😕
review.name: Weird fit

name: Los Gatos Crew Fleece Jacket - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Chris King Headset Spacer Kit online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I replaced my mtb frame and the shop installed a mix of carbon fiber and aluminum spacers on my fork. Over time the carbon finer spacers warped so that I would get violent brake shudder on my front wheel due to the spacers not being flat anymore.

On a advice from a friend, I replaced all those crappy spacers with this Chris king set. Night and day difference. My brake shudder is gone and I am back to loving my bike again. They are ?expensive?, but the fix was worth much more.

These are well machined and look great. I got mango which is really just orange. 

If you have loose headset issues (depress front brake and see if there is any play between the fork and the headset), but these!
review.name: Loose Headset fix

name: Headset Spacer Kit

review.reviewBody: I adore and love these shoes. I'm only 5'0" so these boots are absolutely flattering on my frame. I am a 6.5- 7 in women's but I sized down to a 6 and the boot feels perfect.
review.name: Perfect size for short women

review.reviewBody: As soon as I saw in Night fall, I had to get them. I I love the unique color, and easy to match with clothes. I wish I could buy another pair again next time. And of course, very comfy and warm. Water and stain resistant, true to size!
review.name: I love them!

review.reviewBody: Color-Chestnut! Length-Classic Mini! Absolute Favorite and I wear them all year long!
review.name: Absolute Favorite!!

review.reviewBody: I wear these every day, especially in the cold weather and I love them! they are so cozy. Definitely need another pair!
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: I wasn't sure that I would love these as much as the talls, but I actually like the fit a little more because they don't wrinkle at the ankle
review.name: First pair of minis

review.reviewBody: Always take a size 8 these were too small recommend bigger size
review.name: Boots

review.reviewBody: Fit beautifully. I went one size up contrary to what I had read, because I jus knew it would fit beautifully and I was right!!! They were perfect and so comfortable...I may just wear them before the cold weather...kind of a funky bohemian look with a beanie. Thanks UGG!!! I love them!
review.name: Great Boot!!

review.reviewBody: Came in 2 days! I wear an 8 in woman, I feel in the future I'd buy a 9 so can slip my feet in easier.
review.name: Fast Shipping

review.reviewBody: They are so comfortable and they keep my feet so warm
review.name: I would buy these boots over and over again

review.reviewBody: My shoes order fast they got here in 3 to 5 days and when they came they were shipped and dropped of properly but when i opened the box the shoes where fine it just had crumbs on them.
review.name: This is a great product but i had some issues

name: Classic Mini II Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I found a classy replacement for my old Jansport. I love my new Deuter pack. I highly recommend this product. No zipper up top but it doesn't bother me.
review.name: High Quality

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag because I could afford it and it was the right size for an international trip. The size and quality were good for travel needs. Comfortable to hike with and carry through stations and airports. The light color however means that it gets REALLY dirty, fast. Just from storing in compartments it has black marks all over, even on the faux leather parts.
review.name: Good bag for travel, horrible color
